meanings.definition: Of or relating to Orpheus or his poetry.
meanings.sent1: The students were captivated by the orphic melodies of the musician.
meanings.sent2: The orphic verses of the poet painted vivid images in the listeners' minds.
meanings.sent3: The orphic tales of the ancient bard seemed to transport the audience to another realm.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had an orphic quality that seemed to enchant all who heard it.
meanings.sent5: The orphic nature of the lyrics left a lasting impression on the audience.

meanings.sent1: The forest was filled with an orphic aura that seemed to beckon travelers deeper into its depths.
meanings.sent2: The dancer moved with an orphic grace that mesmerized the audience.
meanings.sent3: The orphic glow of the fireflies in the night sky created a magical atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The painting had an orphic quality that drew viewers in, as if under a spell.
meanings.sent5: The orphic beauty of the sunset painted the sky in hues of gold and pink.
